node.title: Albion at Loyola Station (also Higher Ed)
node.content: 29-unit market rate housing development on Loyola University's Chicago campus. The project was completed on a nine month schedule

node.title: American Society of Anesthesiologists
node.content: Construction of new 75,000-square-foot, three-story built-to-suit office headquarters for education research and physician association.

node.title: Axley Place
node.content: Two-building, 13-unit affordable housing development. The 11,200-square-foot apartments feature one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments, including three ADA compliant units and three adaptable units. Project included IHDA-funding. (August 2015 – September 2016)

node.title: Capital One
node.content: 22,000 SF tech incubator space buildout that expands upon Capital One’s flagship space in Chicago. Features flexible working environments with huddle rooms, modular conference room and open office with movable desk configurations. (August 2016 – January 2017)

node.title: Cicchetti Sopraffina
node.content: 9,200 SF dual restaurant buildout and hospital retrofit, including 2,000 square foot mezzanine. This initiative was part of the Shop & Dine Northwestern program. (July 2013 – November 2013)

node.title: Dentons
node.content: Three-floor interior buildout of law firm at Willis Tower. Project included two communicating stairs, demountable office fronts and high end custom millwork and finishes.

node.title: DeVry
node.content: New 85,000 SF two-story flagship higher education facility. Includes enhanced building envelope, green roof component, 22 classroom spaces and adjacent staff offices. (December 2010 – January 2013)

node.title: Enova
node.content: Three-floor interior buildout of open-plan corporate office space. Project includes full-floor call center with 24-hour supplemental heating and cooling.

node.title: Erie Family Health Center Evanston
node.content: Renovation of a former warehouse and recording studio space into a 17,000 square foot free and low-cost medical clinic. Contains 15 exam rooms and five dental suites and was completed almost two weeks ahead of schedule.

node.title: Erie HealthReach Waukegan
node.content: 30,000-square-foot adaptive building reuse to accommodate clinical healthcare services, dental services, staff offices and pharmacy.

node.title: FJ Mercedes Ontario - SF
node.content: New 100,000 square foot luxury automotive dealership. The precast and structural steel building included 58 service bay areas and required site work on 8 acres of land.

node.title: Fletcher Jones Audi Beverly Hills - SF
node.content: Renovation of two luxury automotive dealerships. This 50,000 square foot project was extensively renovated in 13 weeks.

node.title: Fletcher Jones Audi North Ave Chicago
Fountainview at Lincoln Square
node.content: New mixed-use, four-story building with 18 residential units, retail and underground parking. This LEED Silver certified project was constructed on a zero-lot line urban site heavily traveled by pedestrians.

node.title: Google
node.content: 357,000 SF office relocation to new West Loop development. Includes full-service prep kitchen, seven-story stair, a roof deck, open office concept and multiple conference areas. Project is LEED V4 certified and is attempting certification with Living Building Challenge and WELL Building. Project marks the first LEED V4 in the city of Chicago and the first project to ever attempt all three certifications. (January 2015 – November 2015)

node.title: KCura
node.content: Interior buildout and expansion of multiple floors for legal software development company. Space features agile pods, raised floors and exposed deck with Aktura blase system.

node.title: Lakeshore Residences of Grayslake
node.content: 75,000 SF affordable independent senior living facility includes 70 residential units. The project also features deep well geothermal heating with twenty-two 400’ vertical wells, heat exchanging system and complete hydronic system appurtenances. The site features a 3-acre detention pond, 50-car client parking area and native planting landscaping development. (November 2011 – October 2012)

node.title: Mead Johnson
node.content: 64,000-square-foot interior office buildout for Mead Johnson, a leading nutrition company for babies and children. The baby formula company has relocated its corporate headquarters from Glenview to 444 W. Lake Street in downtown Chicago. The three-floor project included a 1,500-square-foot slab cut for a self-supporting feature staircase with custom rails and a 2,000-square-foot one of a kind Arktura ceiling baffle system. (October 2016 – March 2017)

node.title: Motorola Mobility
node.content: 600,000-square-foot, four-floor global headquarters relocation and base building infrastructure upgrade at the Merchandise Mart. Includes open office space, R & D laboratories, server/LAN rooms and a 50,000-square-foot rooftop terrace.
node.address_address: 222 W Merchandise Mart Plaza #1800, Chicago, IL 60654

node.title: NM Multi-care Rooms
node.content: 12,060 SF renovation and repurposing of existing shell and admin spaces for new patient rooms and support areas. Project included major mechanical infrastructure modifications and new systems and finishes for optimum patient care. Project was completed within an active hospital with zero interruptions to the existing operations. (November 2015 – February 2016

node.title: NMC Retail
node.content:
Various renovations and additions of new retail space within hospital. This 32,000 square foot project includes significant infrastructural improvements, a new structural steel retail facility and extensive rework and additions to mechanical systems.
Project included the buildout of a 4,000 square foot Au Bon Pain restaurant and bakery inside of Northwestern Memorial Hospital. Extensive outside vendor coordination and sensitivity to hospital loading dock schedule, vital to hospital operations, were required to complete the project within the necessary time frame.
node.clientowner: Northwestern Memorial Hospital | Au Bon Pain
node.architect: HOK | Kiku Obata & Company | Facility Solutions Group

node.title: NMH Bridge Connection
node.content: 10,500 square foot renovation of common area space at the junction of the Feinberg Pavilion and newly constructed Outpatient Care Pavilion.

node.title: NMH ICU
node.content: Extensive renovation of 7th, 8th, and 9th-floor Intensive Care Units as part of ongoing refurbishment at Northwestern Memorial Hospital’s Galter and Feinberg Pavilions. Encompassing over 76,000 square feet, each project was phased and expedited without causing disruption to hospital operations.

node.title: North Shore Place
node.content: 175,000 SF construction of new five-story, 157-unit assisted living facility. Consists of 40 one- and two-bedroom apartments for those requiring memory support services. Cast-in place structure with masonry exterior. (February 2013 – June 2014)

node.title: Oak Hill Supportive Living Facility
node.content: New supportive affordable senior living facility includes 94 residential units and multiple common areas. Lean Project Delivery methods accelerated the schedule and allowed for completion in 9 months. This project is the first NGBS-Gold Rated Energy Efficient Senior Living Development in the State of Illinois.

node.title: Quarles & Brady
node.content: Three-floor interior buildout of prestigious law firm. This 75,000 square foot LEED Gold certified office features Operable Skyfold partitions, custom wood paneling, wood flooring and ceiling and a mock court room.

node.title: Soho House
node.content: 50,000 SF owner-driven alterations to newly constructed high-end private club house. Scope of work includes phased renovations to occupied boutique hotel, public restaurants, bars, event spaces, theatre, lounges and a rooftop bar with pool deck. (June 2014 – August 2014)

node.title: Southwick Place
node.content: 40-unit affordable housing development. All units are ADA accessible and this development was designed specifically for those who use wheelchairs or need other assistance with mobility.

node.title: Sprout Social
node.content: 64,000 SF full-floor interior buildout of the corporate headquarters for a social media management company. (August 2016 – November 2016)

node.title: SRAM
node.content: 74,000 SF interior buildout including a paint booth, lab and a machine shop. Architectural features include a useable bike track throughout the space, exposed concrete floors and a stacked wood wall feature. Project was awarded 2 Green Globes under the Sustainable Interiors certification system.

node.title: Swift & Sons
node.content: 15,750 SF interior buildout of a high-end restaurant in Chicago’s Fulton Market neighborhood. Project features oyster bar, bistro bar and private dining rooms in addition to the main dining room. (January 2015 – October 2015)

node.title: The Residences of Lake in the Hills
node.content: New two-story affordable independent senior living facility includes 92 residential units, common areas, extensive millwork and landscaping. Lean Project Delivery methods streamlined processes and reduced the schedule by three months.

node.title: The Springs at Monarch Landing
node.content: New 118-unit skilled nursing facility on full senior living campus.

node.title: The Villas of Lake in the Hills
node.content: 75,550 SF new construction of a 60-unit affordable and independent senior living facility made up of two- and three-bedroom apartments. (June 2014 – March 2015)

node.title: United Way
node.content: 28,000 SF office relocation and buildout for non-profit organization. Collaborative, modern office space completed on expedited schedule. (January 2013 – April 2013)

node.title: Whole Foods
node.content: 50,000 SF regional headquarters with wood ceiling at lobby entrance that was design/built. Whole Foods products and branding showcased throughout space. Completed three weeks ahead of schedule and under budget. (August 2010 – November 2011 (10 weeks); November 2013 – February 14 (12 weeks))
